intro: Mascarenhasia gerrardiana, commonly known as the Mascarene dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a distinctive, rough texture. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh maritime environment. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and supporting biodiversity in its native habitat.
